entries.title: 'Frances Oldham Kelsey, the FDA, and the Battle Against Thalidomide' Review: The Noble Bureaucrat
entries.description: Revisiting an FDA scientist’s stand against a drug that was shown to cause birth defects when used by pregnant women.

entries.title: S&P 500 Slips; GameStop Shares Retreat
entries.description: The Nasdaq and S&P 500 declined, and the Dow edged lower as well, while election jitters rattled markets overseas.

entries.title: Who Needs TV When You Have the Journal?
entries.description: ‘Today’s televisions are too large, making the latest dramas more calamitous than they are.’

entries.title: 'Mixed-Breed,' if You Will
entries.description: Call a mutt a mutt.

entries.title: Israel Needs the Death Penalty for Terrorists
entries.description: The Hamas rapist-murderers of Oct. 7 should qualify for the Eichmann treatment.

entries.title: U.S. Prosecutors Probe Global Hacking-for-Hire Operation
entries.description: U.S. prosecutors are seeking to extradite an Israeli private investigator from London as part of a probe into an alleged globe-spanning hacking-for-hire operation that targeted opponents of Elliott Management and Exxon Mobil.

entries.title: Gold Futures Slide as Lower Swiss Exports Point to Weak Demand
entries.description: Gold futures slid after Swiss export data signaled subdued demand in April.

entries.title: Databricks to Buy Data-Management Startup Tabular in Bid for AI Clients
entries.description: Databricks is acquiring Tabular, a data-management startup that helps companies use a variety of open-source data formats, as the company looks to win artificial intelligence customers by making it easier for them to use their own data with AI.

entries.title: Frontdoor to Buy 2-10 Home Buyers Warranty in $585 Million Deal
entries.description: The company said the deal adds a new business line that complements its existing home-warranty customer base.

entries.title: The U.S. Gave Chip Makers Billions. Now Comes the Hard Part.
entries.description: The Chips Act is supposed to supercharge U.S. chip making, but the program’s early stages have been challenged by rivals overseas as well as the sheer expense of manufacturing chips.

entries.title: AI Employees Fear They Aren't Free to Voice Their Concerns
entries.description: A group of current and former OpenAI and DeepMind employees said they want more whistleblower protections and fear retaliation.

entries.title: MLB Player Banned for Life for Betting on Baseball
entries.description: San Diego Padres infielder Tucupita Marcano is one of five baseball players punished by the league for violating the sport’s policy on gambling.

entries.title: Patton Oswalt on the Origin of His Name and the Benefits of Being Funny
entries.description: The actor-comedian and ‘The 1% Club’ host on his comedy clique, bombing his first stand-up and how ‘The King of Queens’ changed his career.

entries.title: Should a Retired Couple Get a Dog? He Says Yes. She Says No.
entries.description: There’s nothing like the emotional support you get from a dog. But will it pin us down too much?

entries.title: Best Buy Catches AI Fever
entries.description: Tech upgrades are coming, but the hype in the retailer’s stock might be overdone.

entries.title: U.S. Natural Gas Futures Consolidate After Jump
entries.description: U.S. natural gas futures dipped after Monday’s big gains, with this week’s hot weather seen driving power-sector demand.

entries.title: Merrick Garland, Three Special Counsels and a Justice Department Under Fire
entries.description: The attorney general has tried to stay above the political fray while overseeing investigations into Trump, Biden and his son.

entries.title: Biden's Cease-Fire Plan Seeks to Push Hamas and Israel Into a Deal Neither Wants
entries.description: The U.S. president is more interested in a deal than the two warring parties.

entries.title: Euro Falls as Dollar Recovers
entries.description: The euro weakened against the dollar as the U.S. currency recovered from Monday’s slump prompted by weak ISM manufacturing data.

entries.title: Cannabis Producer Seeks Boston Beer Merger
entries.description: In a letter, the Green Thumb CEO outlined the potential benefits of a combination, including allowing the cannabis company to be listed on a major U.S. exchange.
